DataElement.preferredDefinition: The length of the third dimension/diameter of a tumor that has been measured in a planar direction relative to dimensions 1 and 2, represented as a numeric value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Results Domain Neoplasm Second Greatest Diameter Third Greatest Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that represents quantitative measurements and/or qualitative assessments of the tumors identified in the TU domain._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._The second longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a nearly circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference._The third longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a nearly circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that represents quantitative measurements and/or qualitative assessments of the tumors identified in the TU domain.

Property.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The third longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a nearly circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The third longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a nearly circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
